1 'use strict';
  2 
  3 var _ = require('underscore');
  4 
  5 module.exports = function(AV) {
  6   /**
  7    * Creates a new instance with the given models and options.  Typically, you
  8    * will not call this method directly, but will instead make a subclass using
  9    * <code>AV.Collection.extend</code>.
 10    *
 11    * @param {Array} models An array of instances of <code>AV.Object</code>.
 12    *
 13    * @param {Object} options An optional object with Backbone-style options.
 14    * Valid options are:<ul>
 15    *   <li>model: The AV.Object subclass that this collection contains.
 16    *   <li>query: An instance of AV.Query to use when fetching items.
 17    *   <li>comparator: A string property name or function to sort by.
 18    * </ul>
 19    *
 20    * @see AV.Collection.extend
 21    *
 22    * @class
 23    *
 24    * <p>Provides a standard collection class for our sets of models, ordered
 25    * or unordered.  For more information, see the
 26    * <a href="http://documentcloud.github.com/backbone/#Collection">Backbone
 27    * documentation</a>.</p>
 28    */
 29   AV.Collection = function(models, options) {
 30     console.warn("AV.Collection is deprecated, please don't use it anymore.");
 31     options = options || {};
 32     if (options.comparator) {
 33       this.comparator = options.comparator;
 34     }
 35     if (options.model) {
 36       this.model = options.model;
 37     }
 38     if (options.query) {
 39       this.query = options.query;
 40     }
 41     this._reset();
 42     this.initialize.apply(this, arguments);
 43     if (models) {
 44       this.reset(models, {silent: true, parse: options.parse});
 45     }
 46   };
 47 
 48   // Define the Collection's inheritable methods.
 49   _.extend(AV.Collection.prototype, AV.Events,
 50       /** @lends AV.Collection.prototype */ {
 51 
 52     // The default model for a collection is just a AV.Object.
 53     // This should be overridden in most cases.
 54 
 55     model: AV.Object,
 56 
 57     /**
 58      * Initialize is an empty function by default. Override it with your own
 59      * initialization logic.
 60      */
 61     initialize: function(){},
 62 
 63     /**
 64      * The JSON representation of a Collection is an array of the
 65      * models' attributes.
 66      */
 67     toJSON: function() {
 68       return this.map(function(model){ return model.toJSON(); });
 69     },
 70 
 71     /**
 72      * Add a model, or list of models to the set. Pass **silent** to avoid
 73      * firing the `add` event for every new model.
 74      */
 75     add: function(models, options) {
 76       var i, index, length, model, cid, id, cids = {}, ids = {};
 77       options = options || {};
 78       models = _.isArray(models) ? models.slice() : [models];
 79 
 80       // Begin by turning bare objects into model references, and preventing
 81       // invalid models or duplicate models from being added.
 82       for (i = 0, length = models.length; i < length; i++) {
 83         models[i] = this._prepareModel(models[i], options);
 84         model = models[i];
 85         if (!model) {
 86           throw new Error("Can't add an invalid model to a collection");
 87         }
 88         cid = model.cid;
 89         if (cids[cid] || this._byCid[cid]) {
 90           throw new Error("Duplicate cid: can't add the same model " +
 91                           "to a collection twice");
 92         }
 93         id = model.id;
 94         if (!AV._isNullOrUndefined(id) && (ids[id] || this._byId[id])) {
 95           throw new Error("Duplicate id: can't add the same model " +
 96                           "to a collection twice");
 97         }
 98         ids[id] = model;
 99         cids[cid] = model;
100       }
101 
102       // Listen to added models' events, and index models for lookup by
103       // `id` and by `cid`.
104       for (i = 0; i < length; i++) {
105         (model = models[i]).on('all', this._onModelEvent, this);
106         this._byCid[model.cid] = model;
107         if (model.id) {
108           this._byId[model.id] = model;
109         }
110       }
111 
112       // Insert models into the collection, re-sorting if needed, and triggering
113       // `add` events unless silenced.
114       this.length += length;
115       index = AV._isNullOrUndefined(options.at) ?
116           this.models.length : options.at;
117       this.models.splice.apply(this.models, [index, 0].concat(models));
118       if (this.comparator) {
119         this.sort({silent: true});
120       }
121       if (options.silent) {
122         return this;
123       }
124       for (i = 0, length = this.models.length; i < length; i++) {
125         model = this.models[i];
126         if (cids[model.cid]) {
127           options.index = i;
128           model.trigger('add', model, this, options);
129         }
130       }
131       return this;
132     },
133 
134     /**
135      * Remove a model, or a list of models from the set. Pass silent to avoid
136      * firing the <code>remove</code> event for every model removed.
137      */
138     remove: function(models, options) {
139       var i, l, index, model;
140       options = options || {};
141       models = _.isArray(models) ? models.slice() : [models];
142       for (i = 0, l = models.length; i < l; i++) {
143         model = this.getByCid(models[i]) || this.get(models[i]);
144         if (!model) {
145           continue;
146         }
147         delete this._byId[model.id];
148         delete this._byCid[model.cid];
149         index = this.indexOf(model);
150         this.models.splice(index, 1);
151         this.length--;
152         if (!options.silent) {
153           options.index = index;
154           model.trigger('remove', model, this, options);
155         }
156         this._removeReference(model);
157       }
158       return this;
159     },
160 
161     /**
162      * Gets a model from the set by id.
163      */
164     get: function(id) {
165       return id && this._byId[id.id || id];
166     },
167 
168     /**
169      * Gets a model from the set by client id.
170      */
171     getByCid: function(cid) {
172       return cid && this._byCid[cid.cid || cid];
173     },
174 
175     /**
176      * Gets the model at the given index.
177      */
178     at: function(index) {
179       return this.models[index];
180     },
181 
182     /**
183      * Forces the collection to re-sort itself. You don't need to call this
184      * under normal circumstances, as the set will maintain sort order as each
185      * item is added.
186      */
187     sort: function(options) {
188       options = options || {};
189       if (!this.comparator) {
190         throw new Error('Cannot sort a set without a comparator');
191       }
192       var boundComparator = _.bind(this.comparator, this);
193       if (this.comparator.length === 1) {
194         this.models = this.sortBy(boundComparator);
195       } else {
196         this.models.sort(boundComparator);
197       }
198       if (!options.silent) {
199         this.trigger('reset', this, options);
200       }
201       return this;
202     },
203 
204     /**
205      * Plucks an attribute from each model in the collection.
206      */
207     pluck: function(attr) {
208       return _.map(this.models, function(model){ return model.get(attr); });
209     },
210 
211     /**
212      * When you have more items than you want to add or remove individually,
213      * you can reset the entire set with a new list of models, without firing
214      * any `add` or `remove` events. Fires `reset` when finished.
215      */
216     reset: function(models, options) {
217       var self = this;
218       models = models || [];
219       options = options || {};
220       AV._arrayEach(this.models, function(model) {
221         self._removeReference(model);
222       });
223       this._reset();
224       this.add(models, {silent: true, parse: options.parse});
225       if (!options.silent) {
226         this.trigger('reset', this, options);
227       }
228       return this;
229     },
230 
231     /**
232      * Fetches the default set of models for this collection, resetting the
233      * collection when they arrive. If `add: true` is passed, appends the
234      * models to the collection instead of resetting.
235      */
236     fetch: function(options) {
237       options = _.clone(options) || {};
238       if (options.parse === undefined) {
239         options.parse = true;
240       }
241       var collection = this;
242       var query = this.query || new AV.Query(this.model);
243       return query.find().then(function(results) {
244         if (options.add) {
245           collection.add(results, options);
246         } else {
247           collection.reset(results, options);
248         }
249         return collection;
250       })._thenRunCallbacks(options, this);
251     },
252 
253     /**
254      * Creates a new instance of a model in this collection. Add the model to
255      * the collection immediately, unless `wait: true` is passed, in which case
256      * we wait for the server to agree.
257      */
258     create: function(model, options) {
259       var coll = this;
260       options = options ? _.clone(options) : {};
261       model = this._prepareModel(model, options);
262       if (!model) {
263         return false;
264       }
265       if (!options.wait) {
266         coll.add(model, options);
267       }
268       var success = options.success;
269       options.success = function(nextModel, resp, xhr) {
270         if (options.wait) {
271           coll.add(nextModel, options);
272         }
273         if (success) {
274           success(nextModel, resp);
275         } else {
276           nextModel.trigger('sync', model, resp, options);
277         }
278       };
279       model.save(null, options);
280       return model;
281     },
282 
283     /**
284      * Converts a response into a list of models to be added to the collection.
285      * The default implementation is just to pass it through.
286      * @ignore
287      */
288     parse: function(resp, xhr) {
289       return resp;
290     },
291 
292     /**
293      * Proxy to _'s chain. Can't be proxied the same way the rest of the
294      * underscore methods are proxied because it relies on the underscore
295      * constructor.
296      */
297     chain: function() {
298       return _(this.models).chain();
299     },
300 
301     /**
302      * Reset all internal state. Called when the collection is reset.
303      */
304     _reset: function(options) {
305       this.length = 0;
306       this.models = [];
307       this._byId  = {};
308       this._byCid = {};
309     },
310 
311     /**
312      * Prepare a model or hash of attributes to be added to this collection.
313      */
314     _prepareModel: function(model, options) {
315       if (!(model instanceof AV.Object)) {
316         var attrs = model;
317         options.collection = this;
318         model = new this.model(attrs, options);
319         if (!model._validate(model.attributes, options)) {
320           model = false;
321         }
322       } else if (!model.collection) {
323         model.collection = this;
324       }
325       return model;
326     },
327 
328     /**
329      * Internal method to remove a model's ties to a collection.
330      */
331     _removeReference: function(model) {
332       if (this === model.collection) {
333         delete model.collection;
334       }
335       model.off('all', this._onModelEvent, this);
336     },
337 
338     /**
339      * Internal method called every time a model in the set fires an event.
340      * Sets need to update their indexes when models change ids. All other
341      * events simply proxy through. "add" and "remove" events that originate
342      * in other collections are ignored.
343      */
344     _onModelEvent: function(ev, model, collection, options) {
345       if ((ev === 'add' || ev === 'remove') && collection !== this) {
346         return;
347       }
348       if (ev === 'destroy') {
349         this.remove(model, options);
350       }
351       if (model && ev === 'change:objectId') {
352         delete this._byId[model.previous("objectId")];
353         this._byId[model.id] = model;
354       }
355       this.trigger.apply(this, arguments);
356     }
357 
358   });
359 
360   // Underscore methods that we want to implement on the Collection.
361   var methods = ['forEach', 'each', 'map', 'reduce', 'reduceRight', 'find',
362     'detect', 'filter', 'select', 'reject', 'every', 'all', 'some', 'any',
363     'include', 'contains', 'invoke', 'max', 'min', 'sortBy', 'sortedIndex',
364     'toArray', 'size', 'first', 'initial', 'rest', 'last', 'without', 'indexOf',
365     'shuffle', 'lastIndexOf', 'isEmpty', 'groupBy'];
366 
367   // Mix in each Underscore method as a proxy to `Collection#models`.
368   AV._arrayEach(methods, function(method) {
369     AV.Collection.prototype[method] = function() {
370       return _[method].apply(_, [this.models].concat(_.toArray(arguments)));
371     };
372   });
373 
374   /**
375    * Creates a new subclass of <code>AV.Collection</code>.  For example,<pre>
376    *   var MyCollection = AV.Collection.extend({
377    *     // Instance properties
378    *
379    *     model: MyClass,
380    *     query: MyQuery,
381    *
382    *     getFirst: function() {
383    *       return this.at(0);
384    *     }
385    *   }, {
386    *     // Class properties
387    *
388    *     makeOne: function() {
389    *       return new MyCollection();
390    *     }
391    *   });
392    *
393    *   var collection = new MyCollection();
394    * </pre>
395    *
396    * @function
397    * @param {Object} instanceProps Instance properties for the collection.
398    * @param {Object} classProps Class properies for the collection.
399    * @return {Class} A new subclass of <code>AV.Collection</code>.
400    */
401   AV.Collection.extend = AV._extend;
402 
403 };
404
